alert.note: Alert for Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 11:20AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...The Yukon River near Marshall to Mountain Village, including the villages of Pilot Station and St. Mary`s. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...An ice jam about 25 mi downstream of Russian Mission has released and is likely to release water to communities downstream of the jam. River levels are expected to continue to rise as impounded high water behind these ice jams continues to push downstream, likely leading to flooding down to Mountain Village. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1102 AM AKDT, An ice jam upstream of Pilot Station released Wednesday night causing water levels to rise 4 feet in Pilot Station with bank-to-bank tightly packed ice and river levels approaching homes near the bank. Water levels have also risen rapidly over night and into this morning in Marshall, St. Mary`s and Mountain Village. Residents in these locations should be prepared for a long period of high water even after the ice jams release. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood If you live near or along the Yukon River from Marshall to Mountain Village stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
